The final shape consists of two intermediate parts. Part 1: Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.375, 0.0]. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system and draw a five-sided polygon as follows: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.125] * Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.125], End Point [0.125, 0.25] * Line 4: Start Point [0.125, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.25] * Line 5: Start Point [0.0, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Close the loop and scale the sketch using a scaling factor of 0.75. Extrude the sketch by 0.375 units towards the normal direction to create the first part with a length of 0.75, width of 0.375, and height of 0.75. Part 2: Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] degrees and a translation vector of [0.125, 0.0, 0.25]. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system and draw a rectangle as follows: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.625, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.625, 0.0], End Point [0.625, 0.125] * Line 3: Start Point [0.625, 0.125], End Point [0.0, 0.125] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.125], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Create a second sketch on face 2 of the coordinate system and draw a rectangle that is identical to the first rectangle. Close the loops for both sketches. Extrude the sketches in the opposite normal direction by 0.125 units to remove material from the first part. Scale the sketches using a scaling factor of 0.625. The resulting part will have a length of 0.625, width of 0.625, and height of 0.125. The final shape will have a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly angled front face. The object has a hollow center and is slightly tapered towards the bottom.</description>
